intro: Actinella scaposa var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth actinella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, leafless stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its smooth, hairless stems and foliage distinguish it from other varieties within the species.
